In a hunting accident, an arrow pierces the mid-calf of a hunter. A major artery is lacerated in the posterior leg, and you notice that the sole of his foot is cold and pale. The dorsum of the foot is warm and normally colored. The artery that seems to be injured is the:
Neurotransmitter secreted by the marked area is

The ketone bodies cannot be utilized by which of the following tissues?

Which of the following, if defective, results in Xeroderma Pigmentosa?

A 32 - year- old female presents to her physician for some advice on fluid replacement during and after running a marathon. She has no known medical history and does not take any regular medications. She has no known allergies, and she denied any family history of cardiac diseases, including sudden cardiac death. On examination, blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, heart rate 65/minute, and oxygen saturation is normal. Auscultation with a stethoscope shows no murmurs, and there is no palpable left ventricular apical impulse. If this patient drank an excessive amount of pure distilled water after the marathon, which of the following effects could be seen?

options.label: A
options.text: Stimulation of osmoreceptors in the hypothalamus

options.label: B
options.text: Increased aquaporin transport in the distal tubule and collecting duct

questions.text: A 69-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with substernal, crushing chest pain. She is emergently moved to the cardiac catheterization lab where she undergoes cardiac angiography. Angiography reveals that the diameter of her left anterior descending artery (LAD) is 50% of normal. If her blood pressure, LAD length, and blood viscosity have not changed, which of the following represents the most likely change in LAD flow from baseline?

A 35-year-old woman comes to her physician complaining of difficulty in walking. On questioning, the patient indicates she had trouble walking for 5 days last month and also that she has experienced pain and prickly sensations that come and go, as well as occasional muscle weakness. Vital Signs: T 36.5°C, P 70/min, R 15/min, BP 124/80 mm Hg, BMI 27. Muscle strength testing: Normal. Deep tendon reflexes: Normal. When asked to walk, the patient had difficulty in balancing and maintaining a normal gait. Patellar tendon reflexes were normal. The muscles, however, were weak. LABORATORY STUDIES- MRI indicated Gd-enhancing brain lesions, as well as one infratentorial lesion and three periventricular lesions in the brain. Analysis of cerebrospinal fluid showed an oligoclonal IgG band. During the initial stages of this disease, how would the velocity of action potential transmission be altered within the central nervous system?

options.label: A
options.text: Myelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity.

options.label: B
options.text: Myelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity.

options.label: C
options.text: Myelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity.

options.label: D
options.text: Myelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show no change in conduction velocity.

questions.correct_answer: D. Myelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show no change in conduction velocity.

questions.text: Given below are four examples of transport across the cell membrane with the type of transport. Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Transport of glucose from the intestinal lumen into intestinal epithelial cell is by secondary active co-transport

options.label: B
options.text: Transport of glucose into adipocytes is by facilitated diffusion

options.label: C
options.text: Movement of Ca++ from cardiac muscle cell to the ECF during muscle relaxation is by Na+-dependent counter transport

options.label: D
options.text: Movement of Na++ ions into a nerve cell during the upstroke phase of the action potential is by facilitated diffusion

questions.correct_answer: D. Movement of Na++ ions into a nerve cell during the upstroke phase of the action potential is by facilitated diffusion

questions.text: A primigravida woman at 33 weeks gestation has been diagnosed with diabetes mellitus. She is rushed to delivery because of signs of preeclampsia. After a caesarean section delivery, the new-born baby is noted to have signs of cyanosis, tachypnoea, and dyspnoea. Which of the following is a characteristic of the substance that is insufficient in the baby?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases compliance of small alveoli

options.label: B
options.text: It consists primarily of Surfactant proteins

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the surface tension of alveoli

options.label: D
options.text: It is produced by type I pneumocytes in alveoli

questions.correct_answer: A. It increases compliance of small alveoli

A 32-year-old man, while laughing at the dinner table during his meal, begins to choke and is starting to turn blue. Fortunately you are present at a nearby table. The following statements are true regarding the initial management of this patient:

options.label: A
options.text: The patient has swallowed a foreign body.

options.label: B
options.text: The Heimlich manoeuvre should be attempted

options.label: C
options.text: The Heimlich manoeuvre involves giving two breaths and 30 chest compressions.

options.label: D
options.text: Obstruction of the right bronchus is more dangerous than obstruction of the larynx.

questions.correct_answer: B. The Heimlich manoeuvre should be attempted

questions.text: A 27-year-old man presents with complaints of chronic nasal congestion. About 2 months earlier, he had an upper respiratory tract infection with rhinorrhea and nasal congestion. Since then he continues to have severe nasal congestion for which he uses oxymetazoline nasal twice daily. Physical examination swollen turbinates and no purulent discharge. What is the most appropriate treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinue oxymetazoline and start steroid nasal spray

questions.correct_answer: D. Discontinue oxymetazoline and start steroid nasal spray

questions.text: During cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), what does a sudden increase in the end-tidal carbon dioxide (ETCO2) level indicate?
Which of the following inhaled anesthetic agents has the fastest onset and recovery time, making it ideal for day care procedures?

A 68-year-old male with a history of hypertension and diabetes is undergoing a hip replacement surgery under general anesthesia. Thirty minutes into the procedure, he suddenly develops hypotension, tachycardia, and a decreased EtCO2. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The sudden onset of hypotension, tachycardia, and a decreased EtCO2 during surgery is highly suggestive of an air embolism, especially in surgeries that involve the use of instruments that can introduce air into the vascular system, such as orthopedic procedures.

questions.text: A 70-year-old patient is scheduled for a total hip replacement under spinal anesthesia. Shortly after the administration of the spinal anesthetic, the patient develops hypotension and bradycardia. What is the most appropriate initial management?

options.label: C
options.text: Place the patient in reverse Trendelenburg position

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is admitted to the ICU with acute respiratory failure. His SpO2 is 85% on room air. Which of the following oxygen delivery devices is most appropriate for initial management?

Your patient is convinced that she has cancer. She is clearly agitated and is complaining of pain in her abdomen. A workup for cancer is negative, yet your patient refuses to accept the diagnosis and becomes increasingly anxious and expresses an intense sense of impending doom. Which of the following drugs is most appropriate for the treatment of this patient?
A patient was observed in her room alone talking loudly and gesticulating, this is probably an example of which of the following?
Which of the following is not a suicide predictor?

A 10-year-old boy was seen by a school counselor after the teachers complained of his behavior in school. He frequently becomes angry towards others and loses his temper in class. His parents report that at home, he refuses to comply with house rules, often stays up later than he is supposed to, and frequently talks back to them. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old woman was recently seen by her primary care physician due to complaints of depressed mood, lack of pleasure, sleep problems, decreased appetite and weight, decreased energy, and problems with concentration. She states that these symptoms started when she was fired from her job about 4 weeks ago, and that since then, she has been unable to function. What is the most indicated treatment at this time?
Which of the following is not corresponding to the biochemical changes in pre-eclampsia?
Which one of the following is a part of diagnostic criteria for the diagnosis of HELLP syndrome?
A 23 years old primigravida has 37 weeks of gestation. Which one of the following would be a considered as parameter of contracted-pelvis?

options.label: A
options.text: Transverse diameter of inlet is 11 cm

options.label: D
options.text: True conjugate at inlet is 11 cm

questions.correct_answer: A. Transverse diameter of inlet is 11 cm

questions.text: Which one of the following is not considered as physiological change in pregnancy?

A 28 years old nulliparous patient has a history of an abortion of 12 weeks and the fetus was found to have anencephaly. She is planning for the next pregnancy. What should be done by her to avoid having another such baby?

options.label: A
options.text: She must take folic acid supplement of 4000mcg as soon as she becomes pregnant

options.label: B
options.text: She must take folic acid supplement of 400 mcg for at least 1 month before attempting pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: She must take folic acid supplement of 4000 mcg for at least 3 months before attempting pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: She must take folic acid supplement of 1000 mcg from the day UPT comes positive.

questions.correct_answer: C. She must take folic acid supplement of 4000 mcg for at least 3 months before attempting pregnancy

questions.text: Match the following:

A 26 years old female G2P1L1 with history of previous caesarean section presents to the ER. She is hypotensive, Fetal heart sounds are absent and fetal parts are easily palpable. What is her diagnosis?
Which of the following finding is most specific for true labour pains?

options.label: A
options.text: Lower abdominal pain radiating from back

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida has come to the OPD at 16 weeks of gestation. Which of the following investigations would not correspond to the diagnosis of OVERT DM?
Which of the following complications would not be associated with GDM?
A 29 years old G2P1L1 has come to the ANC opd for the first time at 19 weeks. Which of the following investigations would not be suitable for her in this ANC visit?
As per Anemia Mukt Bharat Program, the therapeutic doses of iron deficiency anemia and folic acid deficiency anemia in pregnancy is?

options.label: A
options.text: 60 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg folic acid per day

options.label: B
options.text: 120 mg elemental iron plus 1000 mcg folic acid per day

options.label: C
options.text: 60 mg elemental iron plus 1000 mcg folic acid per day

options.label: D
options.text: 120 mg elemental iron plus 4000 mcg folic acid per day

questions.correct_answer: B. 120 mg elemental iron plus 1000 mcg folic acid per day

questions.text: As per WHO intrapartum care guidelines of 2018-19, the active labour begins from what state of cervical dilation?
Identify the following obstetric grip:
During the third stage of labour, the following procedure was done. It is called as?
The following picture is seen in wet mount preparation of a 23 years old woman with vaginal discharge. Which of the following is matching with this clinical case?

options.label: A
options.text: Her partner should be treated as well

questions.correct_answer: C. Fishy foul smell is present

questions.text: Which one of the following is a marker of ovulation in the cycle?

options.label: C
options.text: Biphasic pattern of basal body temperature graph

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of ferning in cervical mucous on Day 22 of cycle.

questions.correct_answer: C. Biphasic pattern of basal body temperature graph

questions.text: What is the name of the following tubal ligation method?

A 63 years old multiparous patient has come with history of post-menopausal bleeding since last 3 months. On per speculum examination, the following finding was noted. Which of the following is next line of investigation?
A 25 years old nulliparous patient underwent USG of pelvis and the following picture was seen in her uterus. Which hormone is responsible for this picture?
A 22 years old P1L1 patient has an ovarian cyst of 8*8cm sized. Usg is suggestive of ROKITANSKY PROTRUBERANCE. Which of the following is the most likely ovarian tumour?
Which of the following complications is not seen with the given anatomical anomaly of the uterus?
Hysteroscopy is the treatment of choice for which of the following conditions?

A 26 years old PCOS patient is taking the following medications for the treatment: Metformin, Myoinositol, Cholecalciferol, Inj. HMG. Which one of these is responsible for ascites, rapid weight gain and severe abdominal pain with breathlessness?
Match tumour marker
In which of the following causes of short stature is bone age consistent with a patient's actual age?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Bone age correlates well with stage of pubertal development and can be helpful in predicting adult height in early- or late-maturing adolescents. In familial short stature, the bone age is normal (comparable to chronologic age). In constitutional delay, endocrinologic short stature, and undernutrition, the bone age is low and comparable to the height age.

questions.text: A 6 years old child comes with complain of bedwetting. The child is continent during the day and problem is only at night. Growth and development are normal. Urine microscopy is normal and urine specific gravity is 1.020. How will you manage?

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure the parents and follow up after 6 months

questions.correct_answer: A. Reassure the parents and follow up after 6 months

questions.text: At what age would a child with no teeth be considered to have delayed eruption?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Delayed eruption is usually considered when there are no teeth by approximately 13 mo of age (mean + 3 standard deviations). Common causes include hypothyroid, hypoparathyroid, familial, and (the most common) idiopathic disorders

questions.text: Key features of kangaroo mother care are all the following EXCEPT ?

options.label: A
options.text: Skin to skin contact between mother and baby

options.label: C
options.text: Initiated in a facility and continued at home

questions.correct_answer: D. Done for babies with cyanosis
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Kangaroo Mother Care:
  • ↳ KMC was first suggested in 1978 by Dr Edgar Rey in Bogota, Colombia.
  • ↳ Benefits: A Cochrane review on benefits of KMC demonstrated that: Improved exclusive breast feeding rates at discharge, at 1-3 months of and a trend towards improved rates at 6-12 months  Reduction in the risk of mortality  Reduction in nosocomial infection/sepsis  Reduction in hypothermia  Reduction in length of hospital stay o Components of KMC  Kangaroo position: The kangaroo position consists of skin-to-skin contact (SSC) between the mother and the infant in a vertical position, between the mother’s breasts and under her clothes  Kangaroo nutrition: Kangaroo nutrition is the delivery of nutrition to “kangarooed” infants as soon as oral feeding is possible.  Kangaroo discharge and follow up o When to discontinue KMC? Often this is desirable until the baby's gestation reaches term or the weight is around 2500 g. o Post-discharge follow-up: Baby is followed once or twice a week till 37-40 weeks of gestation or till the baby reaches 2.5 to 3 kg of weight. Thereafter, a follow up once in 2-4 weeks may be enough till 3 months of post-conception age

questions.text: A 32-weeks 1400 g neonate is born to a primigravida. The baby did not require resuscitation and showed stable vitals. The baby was transferred to the NICU. How will you manage the feeding of the patient ?

options.label: A
options.text: Start total enteral feeding and IV feeding not required

options.label: B
options.text: Start IV feeding with minimal enteral feeding

options.label: C
options.text: Start IV feeding and introduce feeding on 2nd day of life

options.label: D
options.text: Start parenteral feeding and institute oral feeding on 2nd day of life

questions.correct_answer: A. Start total enteral feeding and IV feeding not required
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Feeding of a low birth weight newborn

questions.text: A 9-year-old boy is brought with history of decreased urine output, cola colored urine and swelling of the face and hands of 2 days duration. He is hypertensive, has a puffy face and pitting edema of the lower limbs. He has history of skin lesions 4 weeks earlier. A diagnosis of post streptococcal glomerulonephritis is made C3 levels are likely to return to normal in?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Usually complement levels normalize within 6–8 weeks, if hypocomplementemia persists more than 3 months one should strongly consider an alternative diagnosis (membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis).

questions.text: The renal biopsy of a 6 years old boy with recurrent gross hematuria shows lgA nephropathy. The urinary protein excretion is 130 mg/day. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management:

A 6 month infant presented with recurrent episodes of polyuria and dehydration. Lab test revealed serum Na of 130 meq/L, K of 3 meq/ L, CI- of 92 meq/L, bicarbonate of 30 meq/L. pH was 7.48. Serum creatinine was 0.4 mg/dl. The patient had hypercalciuria and ultrasound showed medullary nephrocalcinosis. Which or following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2 yr old boy is presented to the emergency department at 3 AM with a chief complaint of fever and cough. His respiratory rate is 36 breaths/min, his temperature is 39°C, and his pulse oximetry reading is 96%. On physical examination he has a barky cough and stridor only with crying. He is well hydrated, able to drink, and consolable. What is the appropriate next step in patient management?

options.label: A
options.text: Nasal washing for influenza virus and respiratory syncytial virus

questions.text: On examination of a full-term newborn, the physician notes mild hepatomegaly. Other physical findings are normal, including head circumference and appearance of the retinas. A urine culture grows cytomegalovirus (CMV). Results of head ultrasonography are normal. Subsequent testing discloses no metabolic disorders. The deficit most likely to occur in the next year is:
Patient with nasal discharge and mild dyspnea.
Identify the diagnosis-
This patient on CT scan has a mass in mediastinum and shows -62HU. What is the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Mediastinal mass with calcification and fat Teratoma

questions.correct_answer: A. Mediastinal mass with calcification and fat Teratoma

questions.text: Patient having high grade fever with foul smelling sputum with fluid filled image of lungs –
What is the diagnosis in the image?
